title: Liselle Sambury
text:
Liselle Sambury is a Canadian writer of young adult fantasy literature, whose debut novel "Blood Like Magic" was a shortlisted finalist for the <a href="Governor%20General%27s%20Award%20for%20English-language%20children%27s%20literature">Governor General's Award for English-language children's literature</a> at the <a href="2021%20Governor%20General%27s%20Awards">2021 Governor General's Awards</a>.
A native of <a href="Toronto">Toronto</a>, <a href="Ontario">Ontario</a>, Sambury studied creative writing at <a href="Queen%27s%20University%20at%20Kingston">Queen's University</a>. "Blood Like Magic" was published in 2021 by <a href="Simon%20%26amp%3B%20Schuster">Simon & Schuster</a>. She currently resides in <a href="Timmins">Timmins</a>, a city which she has incorporated as a setting in her planned future novel "Butcherbirds".
